title: Olympia Visibility Brigade Protest
description: Join us for a protest led by Olympia Visibility Brigade. We meet each weekend on overpasses in the Olympia-Tumwater-Lacey area and on Mondays during evening rush hour to support Capitol protests. Bring signs, flags, costumes, and a good mood. Introverts are welcome!
address: Pedestrian bridge over I-5, Tumwater (near Home Depot)
meeting_location: Pedestrian bridge over I-5, Tumwater (near Home Depot)
raw_text: Impatient for the next big protest? Us too! Join us weekly to make good trouble! OLYMPIA VISIBILITY BRIGADE We deploy each weekend on overpasses in the Olympia-Tumwater-Lacey area We also deploy on Mondays during evening rush hour We support Capitol protests when possible Bring your high-viz protest signs, flags, fun costumes, a good mood, and be tolerant of terrible dancing. Introverts welcome! Upcoming Event: Monday, June 16th @ 4:30 - 6:30 pm Pedestrian bridge over I-5, Tumwater (near Home Depot) Look for upcoming Olympia Visibility Brigade events at theblop.org and backbonecampaign.org
raw_summary: The flyer is announcing an upcoming protest organized by the Olympia Visibility Brigade. It describes weekly deployments at specific locations, invites participation with signs and costumes, and mentions an event on June 16th from 4:30 to 6:30 PM at a pedestrian bridge over I-5 in Tumwater, near Home Depot. Websites theblop.org and backbonecampaign.org are included for more information.

title: Protect Free Speech - No Banned Book, No Banned Words Rally
description: Join The Lantern League and other Team No Nonsense friends to protect and defend free speech. No Banned Books, No Banned Words. We will have words written on card stock for all to hold, bring your favorite commonly banned book and posters. We are supporting libraries, the Library of Congress and decrying the banning of words from government websites, from grant applications and the practice of book banning.
raw_text:
Protect Free Speech - No Banned Book, No Banned Words Rally

Photo by Jan Mellström on Unsplash

Join The Lantern League and other Team No Nonsense friends to protect and defend free speech.

No Banned Books, No Banned Words.

We will have words written on card stock for all to hold, bring your favorite commonly banned book and posters. We are supporting libraries, the Library of Congress and decrying the banning of words from government websites, from grant applications and the practice of book banning!

6 Attendees

Hosted by
Kathleen C.

STARTS ON
Monday, June 16, 2025 at 6:00 PM EDT
ENDS ON
Monday, June 16, 2025 at 7:00 PM EDT

Denville, NJ, 07834
United States
Full address will be provided upon RSVP
raw_summary: The image advertises a rally titled "Protect Free Speech - No Banned Book, No Banned Words Rally." It invites people to join "The Lantern League" and "Team No Nonsense friends" to protect free speech. The event will feature words written on card stock, encourage participants to bring commonly banned books, and support libraries and the Library of Congress. It addresses issues about the banning of words from government websites and grant applications. The event is scheduled for June 16, 2025, in Denville, NJ. Kathleen C. is hosting the event.

title: Rally & Candlelight Vigil for Due Process
description: Join us on Tuesday, June 17, for a rally and candlelight vigil at Medina Square from 7-9 PM. We will express ourselves, honor the Disappeared, and accept donations to the ACLU. Activities include bringing signs, flags, instruments, and readings during the vigil.
raw_text:
RALLY & CANDLELIGHT VIGIL FOR DUE PROCESS
TUES., JUNE 17
7-9 PM
MEDINA SQUARE

ACCEPTING DONATIONS TO THE ACLU

RALLY (7-8 PM)
BRING A SIGN
BRING A FLAG
BRING AN INSTRUMENT
BRING A NOISEMAKER

VIGIL (8-9 PM)
CANDLES PROVIDED
BRING A POEM TO READ
BRING A STATEMENT

We will take turns expressing ourselves & honoring the Disappeared.

Since Trump’s inauguration, hundreds of migrants and US citizens have been arrested, detained, and/or sent to foreign prisons WITHOUT DUE PROCESS.
raw_summary: The image announces a rally and candlelight vigil for due process. It will take place on Tuesday, June 17, from 7-9 PM at Medina Square. The event will accept donations to the ACLU, and activities include bringing signs, flags, instruments, and readings.

title: Register NJ Voters with Field Team 6 Postcards
description: Help register Blue Voters for the NJ Governors Race! Field Team 6 provides the SCRIPT, addresses, postcards, voter registration QR code, and stamps. Snacks provided, beer or other beverage is on you. Join like-minded people making a difference. Usual meeting at Fort Nonsense in Randolph; potential location at Glenbrook Brewery.
raw_text:
Register NJ Voters with Field Team 6 Postcards!
Photo by BP Miller on Unsplash

Help register Blue Voters for the NJ Governors Race!
Field Team 6 provides the SCRIPT! the addresses and we will provide the postcards with voter registration QR code, and stamps to help make sure NJ elects a BLUE Governor!
Snacks will be provided, beer or other beverage is on you ;)
The stamps & postcards and instructions are provided.

Come for as long as you wish! Join like-minded people making a difference!
We usually meet at Fort Nonsense in Randolph but we might be participating in a vigil for immigrants and refugees in Morristown, so we may meet at Glenbrook Brewery instead.

Hosted by
Kathleen C.

STARTS ON
Friday, June 20, 2025 at 4:00 PM EDT
ENDS ON
Friday, June 20, 2025 at 6:00 PM EDT

Event Location To Be Announced
Glenbrook Brewery
95 Morris Ave
Morristown, NJ, 07960
United States

This is an approximate location. Once the host has confirmed the event's location, attendees will receive the address via email.
raw_summary: The image promotes an event to register New Jersey voters using postcards. It mentions Field Team 6, who provides materials and instructions. The gathering supports the New Jersey Governors Race, offering snacks, where participants can join at Fort Nonsense in Randolph or Glenbrook Brewery in Morristown on June 20, 2025.

title: Rally & Candlelight Vigil for Palestine
description: Join us in a rally and candlelight vigil for Palestine. The event will start with activities encouraging participants to bring signs, flags, instruments, and noisemakers, followed by a vigil providing candles and opportunities to read poems or statements. Donations are accepted for PCRF and healpalestine.org.
raw_text:
genocide
geno·cide /' jenə,sid/
noun.
The deliberate killing of a large number of people from a particular nation or ethnic group with the aim of destroying that nation or group.

RALLY & CANDLELIGHT VIGIL FOR PALESTINE
TUES, JUNE 24
7-9 PM
MEDINA SQUARE

RALLY (7-8 PM)
BRING A SIGN
BRING A FLAG
BRING AN INSTRUMENT
BRING A NOISEMAKER

VIGIL (8-9 PM)
CANDLES PROVIDED
BRING A POEM TO READ
BRING A STATEMENT

ACCEPTING DONATIONS TO PCRF & healpalestine.org

Since October 6, 2023, over 55,000 Palestinians have been killed. 17,400 children were killed. 66,000 children are severely malnourished. The UN stated Gaza is at risk of famine due to deliberate blockades of food continue.
raw_summary: The image advertises a "Rally & Candlelight Vigil for Palestine" taking place on Tuesday, June 24, from 7-9 PM at Medina Square. It includes a rally from 7-8 PM, encouraging participants to bring signs, flags, instruments, and noisemakers. The vigil from 8-9 PM provides candles and invites participants to read poems or statements. Donations to PCRF and healpalestine.org are mentioned. There is also information highlighting the plight of Palestinians.

title: Protest Festival
description: Join us for the Protest Festival at All Souls Church to celebrate Pride Month. You'll have the opportunity to engage with music, speeches, games, and learn how to advocate for your community. This event is about expressing joy, community connection, and fighting for everyone's rights.
raw_text: DSA SHREVEPORT, IN COLLABORATION WITH A NUMBER OF LOCAL GROUPS, PRESENTS: PROTEST FESTIVAL PRIDE IN DUE PROCESS: RIGHTS FOR Y'ALL MEANS RIGHTS FOR ALL! @ ALL SOULS CHURCH ON JUNE 28TH FROM 12PM TO 5PM SPEECHES, MUSIC, GAMES, AND MORE! COME CELEBRATE PRIDE MONTH WITH US WHILE ALSO LEARNING HOW YOU CAN FIGHT FOR YOUR COMMUNITY! COME PROTEST BY EXPRESSING JOY AND CONNECTING WITH YOUR COMMUNITY. WE WON'T LET THEM SCARE US! WE NEED TO FIGHT FOR OUR RIGHTS, WHICH MEANS WE MUST FIGHT FOR EVERYONE’S RIGHTS!
raw_summary: The image is an event flyer for a 'Protest Festival' hosted by DSA Shreveport, in collaboration with local groups, taking place at All Souls Church on June 28th from 12 PM to 5 PM. The event celebrates Pride Month with activities like speeches, music, games, and learning opportunities for fighting for community rights. The emphasis is on expressing joy and community connection.

title: Elbows Up

raw_summary: The image is an event flyer promoting an international demonstration titled 'Elbows Up,' scheduled on July 5th from noon to 2 PM at the Pembina Port of Entry in Pembina, ND. The event is a peaceful demonstration in support of Canada, America, and democracy. Logos of sponsors such as North Dakota, Minnesota, Fearless, and Red River United Indivisible are included.

title: Elbows Up
description: Join the coalition of organizations from Skagway, Alaska to Burlington, VT, as we line the longest undefended border in the world to rally in solidarity and friendship with our Canadian allies and neighbors. This event is for Canada, for America, and for democracy.
sponsors: Power to the People Upstate New York
raw_text:
FREEDOM PARK  Buffalo & Fort Erie  11am—1pm  TERRAPIN POINT  Niagara Falls  8pm—sunset

Join the coalition of organizations from Skagway, Alaska to Burlington, VT, as we line the longest undefended border in the world to rally in solidarity and friendship with our Canadian allies and neighbors.

RALLY IN SOLIDARITY WITH OUR CANADIAN NEIGHBORS  JULY 5TH, 2025

ELBOWS UP  JULY 5, 2025

FOR CANADA, FOR AMERICA, FOR DEMOCRACY  POUR LE CANADA, POUR LES ÉTATS-UNIS, POUR LA DÉMOCRATIE

SUPPORT CANADA!  #NEVER51 #ELBOWSUP #STANDONGUARD

For more information: elbowsupforcanada.us

In partnership with:  PROTECTING DEMOCRACY  GOOD NEIGHBORS GETTING IT DONE  TROUBLE NATION  POWER TO THE PEOPLE UPSTATE NEW YORK
raw_summary: The image describes an event called "Elbows Up" happening on July 5th, 2025, at two locations: Freedom Park (Buffalo & Fort Erie) and Terrapin Point (Niagara Falls). It is a rally in solidarity with Canadian allies.

title: Celebration of Science, Learning, and Libraries
description: Join us to advocate against the elimination of critical funding to libraries, cuts to science grants, and attacks on education. Gather at Sylvester Park and march to the Capitol Building for speeches.
address: Legislative Building - North Steps, Sylvester Park
raw_text:
Flame the Enlightenment

CELEBRATION OF SCIENCE, LEARNING, AND LIBRARIES

Legislative Building - North Steps, Sylvester Park, Olympia, WA

July 12, 2025

11AM-3PM

Carl Sagan, the science popularizer wrote in the book, "Demon-Haunted World: Science as a Candle in the Dark," that attacks on science, education and libraries brought about the Dark Ages. Meet at Sylvester Park, then march to the North Steps of the Capital Building for speakers. Protest the elimination of critical funding to the Institute of Library Sciences (IMLS), cuts to critical science grants, and the attacks on higher education, and public instruction. Please contact Wendy at 360-349-2158 or wendy.tassoni@gmail.com.
raw_summary: The image is an event flyer for "Celebration of Science, Learning, and Libraries," scheduled for July 12, 2025, from 11 AM to 3 PM. It will take place at the Legislative Building - North Steps, Sylvester Park, Olympia, WA. The event is about advocating against attacks on science and education. It includes a march and talks to protest against funding cuts to libraries and education sectors.

title: March for Integrity
description: Join our movement to end citizens united. We aim to remove money from politics and restore integrity.
raw_text:

MARCH FOR INTEGRITY

raw_summary: The image describes an event called 'March for Integrity' scheduled for July 27, 2025, in Washington D.C. The event is about ending the influence of money in politics with a call to 'End Citizens United.'

title: March for Integrity
description: Join us in Washington, DC for the March for Integrity to advocate for veterans' rights, campaign finance reform, and trust in Congress. Let’s make our voices heard.
